description: This course is designed for advanced undergraduates and beginning graduate students with a particular interest in infectious disease biology. Note that this course is not a comprehensive survey of the field and is not appropriate for students seeking a lecture course on disease. The primary objective of this course is to teach students considering a career in the biomedical sciences how to read, discuss, and question research papers effectively. Intensive classroom discussions focus on the experimental methods used, results obtained, interpretation of these results in the context of pathogen interactions with host cells and organisms, and implications for basic research and therapeutic development.
name: INFECTIOUS DISEASES

values.comments: While most students though Professor Kim was an excellent teacher and very willing to work with students outside of class, almost all were disappointed that he lecture so little and that much of the class time was devoted to student presentations. Students thought the course material would be more clearly presented if the course were more structured. Most students found the course content itself quite interesting.
